Class Orto

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--Camera
        |
        +--Orto
All Implemented Interfaces:
Location
public class Orto
extends Camera

This is a camera that uses orthogonal projection. It is the simplest form and serves mostly as a debugging tool. The images produced are quite boring. However, it is very stable and simple, and objects don't hide behind the camera all the time.

Method Detail

rot

public void rot(double x,
                double y,
                double z)
Description copied from class: Camera
Rotates the camera around in local space. The system uses openGL standard with x being the right axel, y being the up axel, and z being the axel into the screen.
Overrides:
rot in class Camera

project

public Vector3 project(Vector3 p3)
Description copied from class: Camera
Projects a point in 3-space onto the view-plane of the camera. It is up to each sub class how to do this. The value returned should be scaled relative to the values in size. The camera also has the alternative to return null which will signal the point will not be drawn. This should include points behind the camera, or other points that return coordinates on-screen but should not be drawn.
Overrides:
project in class Camera
Following copied from class: Camera
Parameters:
p3 - A point in 3-space to be projected.

collDetect

public boolean collDetect(Vector3 sPoint,
                          Vector3 oPoint,
                          double rad)
Description copied from class: Camera
This method queries if sPoint in view-plane coordinates corresponds to a line through oPoint in 3-space. An error smaller than rad will be tolerated. This is used for selection and querying.
Overrides:
collDetect in class Camera
Following copied from class: Camera
Parameters:
sPoint - A point on the view-plane.
oPoint - A point in 3-space.
rad - The tolerance.
Returns:
true if the two points correspond.
